Categories.name: Books
Categories.category_text: Immerse yourself in the world of literature with our collection of fiction, non-fiction, and children's books, covering a wide range of genres and topics.

items.name: The Catcher in the Rye
items.description: A classic coming-of-age novel by J.D. Salinger

items.name: To Kill a Mockingbird
items.description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning novel by Harper Lee that explores racism and injustice in the American South

items.name: The Great Gatsby
items.description: A novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald that captures the decadence and excess of the Roaring Twenties
A dystopian novel by George Orwell that warns of the dangers of totalitarianism

items.name: Brave New World
items.description: A novel by Aldous Huxley that imagines a futuristic society that has sacrificed freedom and individuality for stability and happiness

items.name: The Lord of the Rings
items.description: A high fantasy novel by J.R.R. Tolkien that follows the quest of a hobbit and his companions to destroy a powerful ring

items.name: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
items.description: The first book in the popular Harry Potter series by J.K. Rowling

items.name: Pride and Prejudice
items.description: A novel by Jane Austen that explores the societal pressures and expectations faced by women in Regency England

items.name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
items.description: A Gothic novel by Oscar Wilde that tells the story of a young man who remains youthful and beautiful while a portrait of him bears the marks of his moral decay

items.name: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
items.description: A humorous science fiction novel by Douglas Adams that follows the adventures of an unwitting human and his alien friend as they travel through space
